alert.note: Alert for Trumbull (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 26 at 8:28PM EST until January 27 at 10:10AM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Ohio... Eagle Creek At Phalanx Station affecting Trumbull County. For the Eagle Creek (Trumbull)...including Phalanx Station...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Eagle Creek at Phalanx Station. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.5 feet, Barclay Messerly Road south of the Warren Airport in Braceville floods. Knowlton Road will be threatened. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM EST Friday the stage was 9.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 8.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.8 feet late this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight. - Flood stage is 9.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.8 feet on 03/24/2022. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 630 AM EST.
